meanings.definition: An excessive or unnecessary correction made to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's constant overcorrections on my essay made me feel discouraged.
meanings.sent2: The overcorrections on the painting took away from its original beauty.
meanings.sent3: The overcorrections on the document were so many that it looked like a rainbow of corrections.
meanings.sent4: Her overcorrections on the recipe turned it into a completely different dish.
meanings.sent5: The overcorrections on the map made it more confusing than helpful.

meanings.definition: The act of correcting something too much or too strongly.
meanings.sent1: His overcorrections of my work made me doubt my own abilities.
meanings.sent2: The overcorrections of the coach only served to demotivate the players.
meanings.sent3: The overcorrections of the editor made the article lose its original charm.
meanings.sent4: The overcorrections of the tailor resulted in a dress that didn't fit well at all.
meanings.sent5: The overcorrections of the architect made the building look awkward and out of place.
